choices.C: Evaluate the impact of the change.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Identify and document the change is the next step the project manager should take after receiving approval for a budget increase to proceed with enhancements specified by a vendor in a project's SOW (Statement of Work).

When a change to a project is approved, it is important for the project manager to identify and document the change in a clear and concise manner. This involves specifying the details of the change, including the nature of the change, the reasons for the change, the impact of the change on the project, and any other relevant information. Documenting the change helps to ensure that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of the change and its implications, and it can also help to support decision-making and risk management processes.

comments.content: If the changes have been approved then why go back to identifying the change? Next step you be to validate, update documents, and then communicate the change.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
First step in a change control process is to Identify and document the change.

questions.question_text: A vendor specifies several enhancement options in a project's SOW. The project manager receives approval for a budget increase to proceed with the enhancements. Which of the following should the project manager do NEXT?

choices.B: extend a formal invitation to the legal department representative to join the CCB.
choices.C: hold a separate meeting with the legal department representative and ask for approval.
choices.A: follow the change process flow and notify the legal department after the change is implemented.
choices.D: notify the legal department representative in the event of an upcoming audit.

questions.answer_description: Reference: Kim Heldman, CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 2nd Edition, Sybex, Indianapolis, 2017, p. 294
questions.question_text:
Due to a new government regulation, a project change is required. The project manager evaluates the change and realizes a representative from the legal department will need to approve the change as well.
The project manager should:

discussion.content:
B. Extend a formal invitation to the legal department representative to join the CCB.

The change process should involve all stakeholders who may be impacted by the change. In this case, since the new government regulation requires approval from the legal department, the project manager should invite a representative from the legal department to join the Change Control Board (CCB) responsible for evaluating and approving changes to the project.
